title: Cashcall loan in 2006. They proceeded to garnish my wages in 2011 and said even BK couldn't help. Is this true?
question: I defaulted in 2008 on the loan.My wages were garnished and I recently filed BK.Are there any repurcussions I can use against them:?
answers: They lied. A bankruptcy discharges payday loans.

If the person that gave you this advice was a licensed attorney, you should file a complaint with the State Bar. If not a licensed attorney, why take legal advice from this person. Hope this perspective helps!

I am not surprised that a payday lender would tell you this, but payday loans are like any other unsecured debt and can be discharged in bankruptcy. You may want to speak with an attorney about any potential claims against this lender for violating the Federal Debt Collection Practices Act or the California Rosenthal Act. .
A BK discharges pay day loans. Only if they filed an Adversary Complaint and were successful would there be an exception: and that is very unlikely.
